trial_identification.studytitle: Prothrombinex-VF vs Fresh Frozen Plasma for the treatment of bleeding post cardiopulmonary bypass
trial_identification.scientifictitle: For patients who experience bleeding after cardiopulmonary bypass, will treatment with Prothrombinex VF as compared to treatment with Fresh Frozen Plasma, decrease the rate of red cell and platelet transfusions?

interventions.interventions: Human 3 Factor Prothrombin complex concentrate (Prothrombinex VF) 25IU/kg IV bolus for the first line treatment of non surgical bleeding post cardiopulmonary bypass.
interventions.comparator: Active control: Fresh Frozen Plasma 15ml/kg bolus IV as first line treatment for the treatment of non-surgical bleeding post cardiopulmonary bypass.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The composite end point of those patients receiving either allogeneic red blood cells or platelets after 15ml/kg FFP or Prothrombinex 25IU/kg
The total cost of treatment following randomisation, which will include, drugs, procedures, imaging, length of stay in ICU and hospital. We will also include best estimation of blood product costs.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Incidence of thrombotic complications defined by CHADx groups: 5.2 (pulmonary embolism) and 5.8 Venous thrombosis/embolism(not progressing to PE) Assessment will be clinical and based on discharge coding.
Length of stay in ICU and Hospital
Total surgical red cell loss (Mercuriali formula)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients undergoing cardiac surgery requiring cardiopulmonary bypass and determined to have non surgical bleeding post heparin reversal.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: The following patient groups will be excluded: 1.Patients with pre-existing bleeding diatheses 2.Patients receiving Prothrombinex or FFP less than 5 days before CPB 3.Patients receiving heart or lung transplant 4.Patients having implantation of ventricular assist devices (VADs)

recruitment.hospital: Fremantle Hospital and Health Service - Fremantle

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Royal Perth Hospital Wellington Street Perth WA 6001

fundingsource.fundingname: WA State Health Research Advisory Committee
fundingsource.fundingaddress: SHRAC C/o Research Development Unit Department of Health PO Box 8172 Perth Business Centre, WA 6849

ethicsAndSummary.summary: A multi centre, randomised, active control, trial of 200 patients comparing Prothrombinex VF with Fresh Frozen Plasma (FFP) as first line treatment for non surgical bleeding after cardiopulmonary bypass.
